AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that believed testimony from border patrol agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron regarding the behavior of individuals in a pickup truck camper during a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in border surveillance, smuggling interception, and immigration inspections, with agents making stops based on reasonable suspicion, including assessments of individuals' appearances
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: appellate court considering the suppression motion on its merits, articulating principles for investigatory stops near the United States-Mexican border, and relying on an agent's observation, also providing guidance on probable cause to search vehicles, and upholding the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: a legal case involving a challenge to the modified Allen charge given to the jury and a request for post-verdict discovery through juror depositions and interrogatories
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographic boundary relevant to immigration and smuggling cases, with its proximity being a factor in justifying investigatory stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where the stop occurred, commonly used for smuggling of aliens, but not directly mentioned in this text chunk
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: a legal case referenced in determining the justification for investigatory stops, and rejecting a general attack on the Allen charge as being inherently coercive
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: a legal case referenced in determining the justification for investigatory stops, and affirming the rejection of a general attack on the Allen charge, with testimony from aliens implicating Maria De Jesus Garcia
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Orona-Sanchez: a legal case referenced in determining the justification for investigatory stops, and upholding the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country of origin relevant to immigration and smuggling cases, referenced in case citations, and differentiated from police states due to its constitutional protections against unreasonable searches
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce standard: legal standard guiding reasonable suspicion for investigatory stops near the border, relevant to the context of United States v. Pena-Cantu and United States v. Orona-Sanchez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S.-Mexican border: an international border relevant to immigration and smuggling cases, with its proximity being a factor in justifying investigatory stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: appellate court making decisions regarding the justification of investigatory stops based on factors such as vehicle loading
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: defendant in a legal case involving a challenge to the modified Allen charge given to the jury and a request for post-verdict discovery through juror depositions and interrogatories, with testimony from aliens implicating her
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron: border patrol agent involved in the stop and search of a pickup truck camper, who testified about the passengers' actions when a flashlight was shone into the vehicle
